utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Terry, I, I, I know that I haven't worked here very long, but I was wondering, do you think it would be possible if I got a $100 advance in my salary?

utterance.speaker: Terry
utterance.content: An advance?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It's so that I can spend Thanksgiving with my family. See, every year we go skiing in Vail, and normally my father pays for my ticket, but I sort of started the whole independence thing, you know, which is actually why I took this job.

utterance.speaker: Terry
utterance.content: Rachel, Rachel, sweetheart. You're a terrible, terrible waitress. Really, really awful.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ok, I, I hear what you're sayin'. I'm with you. Um, but I, but I'm trying really hard. And I think I'm doing better. I really do. Does anybody need coffee? Oh, look at that.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Excuse me, sir. Hi, you come in here all time. I was just wondering, do you think there's a possibility that you could give me an advance on my tips?

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ok, ok, that's fine. Fine. Hey, I'm sorry about that spill before. Only $98.50 to go.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey. Ross, did you know Mom and Dad are going to Puerto Rico for Thanksgiving?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, they're not.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yes, they are. The Blymens invited them.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You're wrong.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I am not wrong.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You're wrong.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, I just talked to them.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I'm calling Mom.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, hey.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And this from the cry-for-help department. Are you wearing makeup?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yes, I am. As of today, I am officially Joey Tribbiani, actor slash model.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That's so funny, 'cause I was thinking you look more like Joey Tribbiani, man slash woman.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What were you modeling for?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You know those posters for the city free clinic?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, wow, so you're gonna be one of those "healthy, healthy, healthy guys"?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You know, the asthma guy was really cute.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Do you know which one you're gonna be?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, but I hear lyme disease is open, so...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Good luck, man. I hope you get it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, you were right. How can they do this to us, huh? It's Thanksgiving.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ok, I'll tell you what. How about I cook dinner at my place? I'll make it just like Mom's.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Will you make the mashed potatoes with the lumps?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You know, they're not actually supposed to have... I'll work on the lumps. Joey, you're going home, right?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: And I assume, Chandler, you are still boycotting all the pilgrim holidays.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, every single one of them.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Phoebe, you're gonna be with your grandma?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yes, and her boyfriend. But we're celebrating Thanksgiving in December 'cause he is lunar.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So you're free Thursday, then.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah. Oh, can I come?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah. Rach, are you thinking you're gonna make it to Vail?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Absolutely. Shoop, shoop, shoop. Only a hundred and two dollars to go.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I thought it was $98.50.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, well it was. I, I broke a cup.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, I'm off to Carol's.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh, ooh! Why don't we invite her?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ooh, ooh. Because she's my ex-wife, and will probably want to bring her, ooh, ooh, lesbian life partner.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi, is uh, is Carol here?

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: No, she's at a faculty meeting.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, I uh, just came by to pick up my skull. Well, not mine, but...Susan: Come in.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thanks. Yeah, Carol borrowed it for a class, and I have to get it back to the museum.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: What's it look like?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Kinda like a big face without skin.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Yes, I'm familiar with the concept. We can just look for it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ok. Wow, you guys sure have a lot of books about bein' a lesbian.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Well, you know, you have to take a course. Otherwise, they don't let you do it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, hey, Yertle the Turtle. A classic.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Actually, I'm reading it to the baby.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: The uh, the baby that hasn't been born yet? Wouldn't that mean you're... crazy?

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: What, you don't think they can hear sounds in there?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You're not serious, I mean, you really... you really talk to it?

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Yeah, all the time. I want the baby to know my voice.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Do you uh, do you talk about me?

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, all the time.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: But um, we just refer to you as Bobo the Sperm Guy.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look, if she's talking to it, I just think that I should get some belly time too. Not that I believe any of this.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, I believe it. I think the baby can totally hear everything. I can show you. Look, this will seem a little weird, but you put your head inside this turkey, and then we'll all talk, and you'll hear everything we say.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I'd just like to say that I'm totally behind this experiment. In fact, I'd very much like to butter your head.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, Rach, did you make your money?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, not even close. Forget Vail, forget seeing my family, forget shoop, shoop, shoop.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Rach, here's your mail.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Thanks, you can just put it on the table.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, here's your mail.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Thanks, you can just put it on the table.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Would you just open it?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my god, oh, you guys are great.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: We all chipped in.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: We did?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You owe me 20 bucks.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Thank you. Thank you so much!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Chandler, here you go, got your traditional Thanksgiving feast, you got your tomato soup, your grilled cheese fixin's, and your family size bag of Funyuns.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wait, wait, Chandler, this is what you're havin' for Thanksgiving dinner? What, what, what is it with you and this holiday?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right, I'm nine years old.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, I hate this story.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: We just finished this magnificent Thanksgiving dinner. I have--and I remember this part vividly--a mouthful of pumpkin pie, and this is the moment my parents choose to tell me they're getting divorced.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my god.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes. It's very difficult to appreciate a Thanksgiving dinner once you've seen it in reverse.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh, hi. We uh, we used to work together.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: We did?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, at Macy's. You were the Obsession girl, right? I was the Aramis guy. Aramis? Aramis?

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Yeah, right.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I gotta tell you. You're the best in the business.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Get out.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I'm serious. You're amazing. You know when to spritz, when to lay back.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Really? You don't know what that means to me.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ooh, you smell great tonight. What're you wearing?

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Listen, uh, you wanna go get a drink or something?

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Yeah. Oh.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What's wrong?

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: I just remembered, I have to do something.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh. What?

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Um, leave.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wait, wait, wait!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So I guess you all saw it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Saw what?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, we were just laughing. You know, how laughter can be infectious.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Set another place for Thanksgiving. My entire family thinks I have VD.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Tonight, on a very special Blossom.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Mmm, looking good. Ok, cider's mulling, turkey's turking, yams are yamming. What?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don't know. It's just not the same without Mom in the kitchen.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right, that's it. You know what? Just get out of my way and stop moping.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That's closer.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I got the tickets! I got the tickets! Five hours from now, shoop, shoop, shoop.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, you must stop shooping.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ok, I'm gonna get my stuff.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Chandler, will you just come in already?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, I prefer to keep a safe distance from all this merriment.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Look out, incoming pumpkin pie!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ok, we all laughed when you did it with the stuffing, but that's not funny anymore.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, Monica, I got a question. I don't see any tater tots.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That's not a question.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: But my mom always makes them. It's like a tradition. You get a little piece of turkey on your fork, a little cranberry sauce, and a tot! It's bad enough I can't be with my family because of my disease.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right, fine. Tonight's potatoes will be both mashed with lumps, and in the form of tots.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ok, I'm off to talk to my unborn child.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ah!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ok, Mom never hit.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ok, all done.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What, Phoebe, did you whip the potatoes? Ross needs lumps!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, I'm sorry, oh, I just, I thought we could have them whipped and then add some peas and onions.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why would we do that?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, 'cause then they'd be like my mom used to make them, you know, before she died.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ok, three kinds of potatoes coming up.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ok, good-bye you guys. Thanks for everything. Oh, sorry! Oh, sorry!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: The most unbelievable thing has happened. Underdog has just gotten away.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: The balloon?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, no, the actual cartoon character. Of course the balloon. It's all over the news. Right before he reached Macy's, he broke free and was spotted flying over Washington Square Park. I'm goin' to the roof, who's with me?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I can't, I gotta go.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Come on. An 80-foot inflatable dog let loose over the city. How often does that happen?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Almost never.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Got the keys? or Got the keys!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Anytime you're ready.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ok, ok, here we go. Ok, where am I talking to, here? I mean, uh, well, there is one way that seems to offer a certain acoustical advantage, but...

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Just aim for the bump.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ok, ok, ok, ok, here goes. You know, I, you know, can't do this. Uh, this is too weird. I feel stupid.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: So don't do it, it's fine. You don't have to do it just because Susan does it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hello, baby. Hello, hello.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I loved the moment when you first saw the giant dog shadow all over the park.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, but did they have to shoot him down? I mean, that was just mean.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ok, right about now the turkey should be crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside. Why are we standing here?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: We're waiting for you to open the door. You got the keys.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No I don't.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes, you do. When we left, you said, "got the keys."

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No I didn't. I asked, "got the ke-eys?"

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, no, no, you said, "got the keys".

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Do either of you have the keys?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: The oven is on.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, I gotta get my ticket!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wait, wait, we have a copy of your key.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well then get it, get it!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That tone will not make me go any faster.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That one will.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And everyone's telling me, you gotta pick a major, you gotta pick a major. So, on a dare, I picked paleontology. And you have no idea what I'm saying, because, let's face it, you're a fetus. You're just happy you don't have gills anymore.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Look, you don't have to talk to it. You can sing to it if you want.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, please. I am not singing to your stomach, ok?

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Hi, how's it goin?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Shh! Here we come, walkin' down the street, get the funniest looks from, everyone we meet. Hey, hey! Hey, uh, did you just feel that?

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: I did.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Does it always, uh--?

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: No, no that was the first.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Keep singing! Keep singing!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, hey, you're my baby, and I can't wait to meet you. When you come out I'll buy you a bagel, and then we'll go to the zoo.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: I felt it!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, hey, I'm your daddy. I'm the one without any breasts.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Nope, not that one.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Can you go any faster with that?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, I got one keyhole and about a zillion keys. You do the math.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why do you guys have so many keys in there anyway?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: For an emergency just like this.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right, listen, smirky. If it wasn't for you and your stupid balloon, I would be on a plane watching a woman do this right now. But I'm not.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I swear you said you had the keys.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, I didn't. I wouldn't say I had the keys unless I had the keys, and I obviously didn't have the keys.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh, ok, that's it. Enough with the keys. No one say keys.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why would I have the keys?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Aside from the fact that you said you had them?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: But I didn't.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, you should have.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Because!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Because!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why? Because everything is my responsibility? Isn't it enough that I'm making Thanksgiving dinner for everyone? You know, everyone wants a different kind of potatoes, so I'm making different kinds of potatoes. Does anybody care what kind of potatoes I want? Nooooo, no, no! Just as long as Phoebe gets her peas and onions, and Mario gets his tots, and it's my first Thanksgiving, and it's all burned, and, and I... I...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ok, Monica, only dogs can hear you now, so, look, the door's open. Here we go.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, the turkey's burnt. Potatoes are ruined, potatoes are ruined, potatoes are ruined.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Here we come, walkin' down the—this doesn't smell like Mom's.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, it doesn't, does it? But you wanted lumps, Ross? Well, here you go, buddy, ya got one.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, god, this is great! The plane is gone, so it looks like I'm stuck here with you guys.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, we all had better plans. This was nobody's first choice.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, really? So why was I busting my ass to make this delicious Thanksgiving dinner?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You call that delicious?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Stop it, stop it, stop it!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Now this feels like Thanksgiving.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ugly Naked Guy's taking his turkey out of the oven. Oh my god. He's not alone. Ugly Naked Guy's having Thanksgiving dinner with Ugly Naked Gal.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I've gotta see this. All right Ugly Naked Guy!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ooh, Ugly Naked Dancing!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It's nice that he has someone.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Shall I carve?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: By all means.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ok, who wants light cheese, and who wants dark cheese?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don't even wanna know about the dark cheese.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Does anybody wanna split this with me?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, I will.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh, you guys have to make a wish.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Make a wish?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Come on, you know, Thanksgiving. Ooh, you got the bigger half. What'd you wish for?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: The bigger half.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I'd like to propose a toast. Little toast here, ding ding. I know this isn't the kind of Thanksgiving that all of you all planned, but for me, this has been really great, you know, I think because it didn't involve divorce or projectile vomiting. Anyway, I was just thinking, I mean, if you'd gone to Vail, and if you guys'd been with your family, if you didn't have syphilis and stuff, we wouldn't be all together, you know? So I guess what I'm trying to say is that I'm very thankful that all of your Thanksgivings sucked.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: That's so sweet.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And hey, here's to a lousy Christmas.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And a crappy New Year.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Here, here!
